textBox.richText: With the potential for Chutes and Cirque, Max decided to ski with me today. We had an additional 5” on top of yesterday’s goodness making the conditions pretty good! Went straight for the top in hopes of the cirque, but when we got there, Pano wasn’t open. The chutes were, so we headed there...did “no name” first. Pretty steep, definitely outta my comfort zone, but Max gave me some great tips (and yes, he totally ripped the **** outta it). Next lap: Upper Tophers, from the Trestle side. We went a little further than my entrance from a couple years ago...while still steep, with that snow, it was a blast. Next lap: more chutes. Max did Jeff’s...but it was a little too narrow for me (not *quite* enough snow) so I did no name again. Pano was open, so we headed for the top. Still no cirque, so we did Belle...and the conditions were *great* in there. Vid below...had cams on both me and max. Lunch after that...good run through the west-side columbine trees, more tophers, more chutes (including baldy...the steepest/scariest thing I think I’ve skied). Good stuff!!!
